column4: hey guys, i have been trying for the past 30 to get ssh to start at system startup using update-rc.d - can anyone lend a hand, seems my linux is out of date
What version of Ubuntu are you using?
All you need to do to get ssh (the server, right?) to start when you boot is install the 'openssh-server' package
There's nothing else required, just `sudo apt-get install openssh-server` and you're done
i have ssh already installe, though i did apt-get install ssh
I meant locally over ssh, it's likely not an ssh issue if you can connect locally
strange, it is saying i already have ssh
'ssh' installs openssh-server, so yeah, you do.
Are you port forwarding at your router successfully?
this is all inside the network
Do you have the correct IP?
i dont suppose you have any ideas on how to autoamte that portion
I don't, no.  I don't deal with wifi a whole lot.  Someone else in this channel can probably help you though, just not me :)
